quiz.question: A few grains of table salt were put in a cup of cold water, kept at constant temperature and left undistributed. Eventually all the water tested salty. This action is due to?

In what range of temperature is the expansion of water anomalous?

Which of the following statements about radioactivity is true?
(i) Alpha particle is positively charged
(ii) Beta particle is negatively charged
(iii) Gamma ray is neutral
(iv) Beta particle has the same mass as helium atom
(v) Gamma ray is charged.
In the study of Physics, temperature and heat are often confused with each other. Which of the following statements correctly defines these two elements?

options.A: Temperature is a measure of the average kinetic energy of the molecules of a substance
options.B: Heat is a measure of the total kinetic energy of the molecules in a system
options.C: Different materials require different amounts of heat to cause a given change in temperature

options.A: In a hospital to obtain photographs of tissues and bones in the body
options.B: For the treatment of malignant growths like cancer cells
options.D: To reveal hidden flaws in metal castings and welded joints work of art

When a sound wave passes from air into water its

options.A: speed and frequency increases but its wavelength remains the same
options.B: speed and wavelength increases but its frequency remains the same
options.D: speed increases but its frequency and wavelength decreases

quiz.question:
A convex mirror is used as a driving mirror because

I. its image is erect
II. it has a large field of view
III. it has a long focal length

Identify the CORRECT statement(s)

A magnetic needle is suspended first at the earth's north magnetic pole and then at a point on the magnetic equator. The respective angles between the needle and the horizontal are
A hydrometer is an instrument for measuring the

options.A: depth of water in a vessel
options.B: relative density of a liquid by the method of flotation
options.C: relative density of a liquid by finding the apparent loss in weight

quiz.question:
Consider the three forces acting at O and in equilibrium as shown in the figure. Which of the following equations is/are CORRECT?

I. P₁cosθ₁ = P₂cosθ₂
II. P₃ = P₁cosθ₁ + P₂cosθ₂
III. P₁sinθ₁ = P₂sinθ₂
The refractive index of a liquid is 1.5. If the velocity of light in vacuum is 3.0 × 10⁸ m/s, the velocity of light in the liquid is

A ship travelling towards a cliff receives the echo of its whistle after 3.5 seconds. A short while later, it receives the echo after 2.5 seconds. If the speed of sound in air under the prevailing condition is 250 m/s, how much closer is the ship to the cliff?

Which of the following statements about defects of vision is/are CORRECT?

I. For a long sighted person, close objects appear blurred
II. For a short sighted person, distant objects appear blurred
III. Short sight is corrected by using a pair of converging lenses

Which of the following conditions are necessary and sufficient for total internal reflection to take place at the boundary between two optical media?

I. Light is passing from optically denser medium to optically less dense medium
II. Light is passing from optically less dense medium to optically denser medium
III. Angle of incidence is greater than a certain critical value
IV. Angle of incidence is lesser than a certain critical value
The linear expansivity of brass is 2 × 10⁻⁵ °C⁻¹. If the volume of a piece of brass is 10 cm³ at 0°C, what will be its volume at 100°C?

The lower and upper fixed points marked on a mercury-in-glass thermometer are 210 mm apart. The end of the mercury column in the tube is 49 mm above the lower fixed point in a room. What is the temperature of the room in degrees Celsius?

II. Television set (220V, 110W)
III. Torchlight (6V, 30W)
IV. Immersion heater (110V, 500W)
